Post title: qtype_calculated Sudden illegal formula syntax and datasetitem error
Post description: I feel like i've been sharing so many question/quiz related errors recently since updating to Moodle 4.4.4. We've run into a qtype_calculated error. These questions were working fine previously but suddenly we got an illegal formula syntax starting with { error. As well as an error " Cannot get the specified dataset for a dataset dependent question! (question: 1091718, datasetitem: 0) ". I've check the unicode and it shouldn't be the reason for the syntax error since it was and should be able to read the character set. Forum Post: 
Post title: students list of ungraded attempt quiz
Post description: Sometimes I allow a quiz to be submitted after the deadline has passed using the User Exceptions tool. Or I allow other students to try to improve their grades on a quiz by giving them extra attempts. At the same time, all students have another new quiz to answer because classes are moving forward and time does not stand still. All teachers have many students. This usually means that after a while I've forgotten which students have ungraded tests or which ones I haven't reviewed yet. Then, to fix this I have to go through each quiz, one by one, to check that all my students have all their attempts graded. This involves a lot of time. I think it will be useful to have a tool that shows us a list of all the students who have an ungraded attempt without having to buy each quiz one by one. Does anyone know if moodle has a tool or tip that allows you to do this? Thank you so much

Post title: Using an external quiz engine
Post description: I have a program running on a server unrelated to Moodle. That program can run quizzes for the user. I would like to somehow integrate this foreign server and its quizzes into Moodle. So, I'm looking for a mechanism that would enable something like this scenario: Student logs in to Moodle Student decides to take a quiz on Moodle Moodle transfers control to the foreign server Student answers questions on the foreign server Foreign server sends quiz results to Moodle Moodle saves results Is there a way to do something like this? (If necessary, some programming of the foreign server is possible.)

Post title: One course - 2 separate identical versions - easy export of quizzes?
Post description: Hi there, For a pilot project in the Caribbean, we will offer free access to our online course 'Coral Reef Architecture & Organisms'. I thus have to duplicate an existing (commercial) course to avoid mixing up paying customers with students accessing the (free) course where they will interact with their teachers. What is the best way of copying the course? I tested it out, and by copying the html code of each topic into the new course, everything seems to be fine (except some links, that will have to be modified) - but what about the quizzes? What is the best way to copy quizzes from one course to a second course? Thank you, Stephan

Forum Post: 
Post title: [3.8.3+] Adding quiz sections, showing multiple questions per section?
Post description: I had read in a very old thread that a quiz could have sections . For me this is good since I want a quiz with the first set of 5 questions relating to one chapter of my content, and the next set of 11 questions relating to a different chapter, and a section with 7 questions, and so on. I'm currently using description question types, but it doesn't look great and it means I have questions in my banks that aren't questions. I went ahead and built the quiz with all the questions. I then clicked on the 'Add' button at the bottom and it gives me these options: a new question from question bank a random question There's no option to add a section. I have discovered what I need to to to put section headings in arbitrary locations within the quiz, which is this: Click the repaginate quiz button Repaginate with 1 question per page. in the 'add' menu for the question BEFORE i want a section heading, click add. This now has the following drop-down a new question from a question bank a random question a new section heading I enter the section heading as I want it, and do this for all locations throughout the quizI click the repaginate quiz button againI then select 'unlimited' questions and update. this collapses down the pages and leaves the sections I've defined.voilà I have sections in the right spots But here's the rub . I wanted to show those 5 questions on the first section all together, since the questions all interrelate and I want the learners to see that. I wanted to show the 11 questions on the section section together. I have the quiz layout set to 'never, all questions on one page' but one there are sections it flat out ignores what you set here. Is there a quiz plugin or behaviour or setting I can fiddle that will allow multiple questions on a section?

Post title: Error reported: abnormal root count
Post description: When I restore a question of an arbitrary question type (not STACK !), I get the following error: 
```text

```
 But: This is due to entries in the table `qtype_stack_prts` which have the value "-1" in the field `firstnodename` - obviously created by the `function process_qtype_stack_prt` in line 142 in `restore_qtype_stack_plugin.class.php` . https://github.com/maths/moodle-qtype_stack/blob/master/backup/moodle2/restore_qtype_stack_plugin.class.php The line 142 says `$data->firstnodename = -1` ; // This will be fixed later. Post title: Unlock activity completion
Post description: Scenario: In a course we have a quiz with no Grade to pass , and under Activity completion option Require passing grade wasn't checked. We want to change both of these so that learners must achieve a grade to pass. Learners have attempted the quiz so we must click Unlock completion options . Under What happens when you unlock the docs say: Once you unlock options and then click 'Save changes', all completion information for the activity will be deleted and, if possible, regenerated according to the new settings. If the new completion option […] is automatic then, depending on the options chosen, the system may or may not be able to construct a correct current value for everyone. Most other options will be recalculated successfully. Surely changing a quiz' grading requiement is an automatic (not manual) completion option? Because the above doesn't happen, learners who previously attempted the quiz and achieved the newly set passing grade are now shown as not having completed the activity. Is it possible to unlock a quiz' activity completion options and get them to be automatically regenerated? And are the docs above wrong or am I misunderstanding them? Moodle 3.9.14+.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Future quiz scores counting as "hidden" in the gradebook
Post description: Hello, When a quiz with has an open date in the future, the grade may be hidden in the gradebook, even if the quiz itself is visible to the students on the course page.  This is a problem, because the default gradebook setting at our school is to hide the course total if it contains hidden items.  Even though the future quiz is available on the course page, the quiz is hidden in the gradebook and so the course total is hidden.  We'd like to keep that default setting, so simply changing the course total settings to "Show total excluding hidden items" isn't an option. After much experimentation, I discovered that the quiz's visibility in the gradebook was determined by the "Points" checkbox in the "Later while the quiz is still open" column of the quiz's Review Options setting:  if the box is checked, the quiz appears in the gradebook.  If that box is not checked, the quiz is hidden in the gradebook.  So one solution to the problem would be to check that box, and allow students who have completed the quiz to view their scores before everyone has completed the quiz.  Unfortunately, one of our instructors doesn't want grades to be visible until after the quiz closes, so checking that box isn't an option for her. Is there some way for the future quiz scores to count as empty, rather than hidden?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Handling Large number of Question Categories at the System Level
Post description: In our current Moodle setup (3.1), we have a large number of question categories. We also have a high degree of question category reuse between courses. As a result we have about 8000 question categories (and growing) in the System context . We are running into issues with how Moodle displays the question categories. It creates a drop down of all categories. This ends up create a dropdown with 8000 items contained in it. Some pages have this dropdown in two places. This is causing both performance issues as well as usability issues. We are working on a way to improve the display of these dropdowns for our site (ideally making it searchable via ajax ), but are unsure what the best way is to tackle the issue. In some places, the dropdown is being displayed with "html_writer" and in others is in a "moodle_form". Many of the locations aren't using renderers. Is there an approach anyone can think of to modify (outside of core) how these dropdowns are being displayed or does it make sense to make a new card in the tracker to add renderers for the question category pages?

Post title: Questions in multiple categories
Post description: This is probably not the best forum for my question, but maybe someone can redirect it or tell me it can be done. I am setting up a series of short quizzes that students complete after each section of work in learning HTML. The course that we have set up gets them to work their way through several exercises and then complete a short review quiz before moving on to the next set of exercises. I am presently setting up my first quiz with a bank of questions. I have set up a number of categories. Unfortunately, the short sections of exercises cover material from several different categories. So I would really like to categorise questions as section1, 2 ... questions in order to quickly generate a random set of questions for each section. At the end of the course, though, I would also like to be able to use the same question base to generate a set of questions covering all the different HTML categories such as text tags, image tags etc. Is there a way to allocate questions to two different sets of categories? If not, would others also find this helpful? Thanks Len PS if anyone has a bank of questions on HTML that they would be willing to share I'd be grateful.

Post title: Quiz Password Modal Doesn't Close
Post description: We are working on using our Moodle v 4.4.1+ for exams. We need to ensure the tests are as secure as they can be.  I've noticed three things I couldn't work around in setting these up.  I was unable to find mention of these on the forums, if these have been posted feel free to let me know. 1) When a student enters the PW and navigates away from the quiz, they can continue their attempt without a password. (we're going to leverage the timer to mitigate, but this isn't ideal) 2) If a student enters a PW for the quiz then enters the quiz, then they use the browser's back button to navigate back to the launch page, the PW modal is still there, with the PW filled in and unmaskable. Also the "Start Attempt" and "Cancel" buttons no longer work. Student needs to navigate away from the launch page and return to get rid of the modal. 3) When using the extra pop-up quiz screen for security... if the student uses PW to get into the test, the student is prompted twice for the PW. If the student uses the browser close window button, the quiz window closes and the modal with the quiz PW form is still there. The PW can be unmasked and viewed. We use online proctors that orally convey the PW and we'd like the student to not be able to freely see it written down. There is a potential that the online proctor is disconnected and the student could unmask and share that PW with students who could open the test prematurely and without proctor. We considered it, but we are unable to use the secure browser for test security.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Auto-increment quiz time
Post description: We are developing a plugin to automatically extend the quiz time limit for users who encounter a network failure.Given below is the information for the same. Background In a quiz where some time gets wasted due to issues like network failures or hardware crash, the user needs to be given additional time to compensate fairly for this loss. Problem There is no way to automatically quantify the lost time. The compensation of the lost time has to be done manually with the help of user overrides. Proposed solution Monitor the health of the connection using heartbeats provided by websockets Record the connections and disconnections of  a user attempting a quiz Calculate the time lost between connections. Automatically set user-overrides to extend the quiz time limit by the amount of time lost. Implementation details NodeJS, ExpressJS, Socket.IO for heartbeat tracking. Trigger moodle to set user-overrides P.S :  Comments, advice and suggestions are gratefully appreciated.

Question categories for 'Quiz: Book 1 Chapter 1 Quiz ' Question categories for 'Course: My Course' Book 1() Chapter 1-MC() Chapter 1-FIB() Chapter 1-Match() Chapter 2-MC() Chapter 2-FIB() Chapter 2-Match() ... so on Book 2() Chapter 1-MC() Chapter 1-FIB() Chapter 1-Match() Question categories for 'Category: My School' Question categories for 'System' Currently, the question banks are listed under the quiz category Question categories for 'Quiz: Book 1 Chapter 1 Quiz ' Chapter 1-MC() Chapter 1-FIB() Chapter 1-Match() And there is a quiz for each chapter so ditto for each chapter in each book. My understanding is that if I put the banks under 'System' then I would be using the same banks for every course I create with these quizzes for every semester.  If I put the banks under 'Course: My Course' then when I copy the course for multiple sections OR for next semester, it will create new versions of the banks?  Not really sure if there is any difference (except organizationally) between course and quiz levels? (maybe being able to create a final exam?)  If I put them under the quiz, then I won't be able to use them to create a final exam? Sorry for all of the questions, but I read the docs and am still not certain? Now that I write it out, I think it would be better to create the banks at the course level so I could pull from them for a final test? MK

Post title: Shown Quiz but Hidden in Gradebook
Post description: I am trying to mark a 10 question quiz as a pass on attempt. Meaning that the student will get full credit for the quiz on attempt regardless of their score. But I also want them to know which questions they got right and wrong. My workaround is to uncheck the "Mark" option under the quiz Review tab under "Later, while the quiz is still open". This shows the quiz and the students are allowed to review their quiz attempt but hides the quiz from the gradebook. Then I created a grade item for each quiz and edited it's calculation as "= Quiz1 /10", "= Quiz2 /10", etc. Then I edited the grade category grade calculation to "=((Sum(ceil( Quiz1 ), ceil( Quiz2 )))/2)*100 This gives me the desired result when I look at the grade book as admin, with the quizzes being graded as either a 1 (for any quiz attempted) or a 0 (for any quiz not attempted) on the grade book but I can still go into each individual quiz and check my attempt. The problem is when I switch to "student" role, the whole category in the grade book is blank.

Post title: Quiz "quick pass" and "quick fail"
Post description: We have a private client that wants to implement some changes to their exam format. They want to do a "quick pass" and "quick fail" functionality. You find this type of functionality with license or state exams. This is when you are moving through the test and it calculates the score as each question is answered. Thereby if the student has no way to pass based on the questions they've answered thus far, the exam will end the attempt, likewise, if they've answered enough questions to have passed, it will also end the attempt. The navigation of the questions would be set to sequential. Anybody have suggestions?

Post title: Question Type: Type to label parts of an image
Post description: Hi everyone, There are lots of tasks where students are required to label parts of a diagram with short answers. Currently, there's the question type of Drag and Drop onto images, but in many cases, we'd want to encourage students to actively think and recall the knowledge rather than to passively choose from a list. I think it'd be great if there's a question type that requires students to type to label parts of an image. My current workaround is to label the parts in the image with questions, which they can't type directly in, and use SHORT ANSWER below the image. It works, but doesn't look good, and can be confusing for primary school pupils. Thank you for reading. Doan

Post title: Should we record licence information with questions?

Post title: Backup of question database is huge
Post description: Hi, and by huge I mean Gigabytes! We have a very large site with tens of thousands of users and thousand+ courses. Our question database contains around 2-3000 unique questions and most are at system level as they are shared. All this works fine. We use backup and restore to create a duplicate course for different schools for example. However, when we run a backup (and select the option to backup questions) things recently started to run very slowly and finally we realized the questions table in the database was enormous. What seems to happen is that all backups contain the entire database of questions and when restored these are duplicated so the number of questions effectively increases exponentially! We have a massive AWS server so have managed so far!!! However, we have recently had to use SQL to delete unused questions but this soon doubles up again. Has anybody any ideas or come across this or anything similar before? We are on the fully patched 3.5 version. Thanks Tom

Forum Post: 
Post title: Save Answer/Response button during exam?
Post description: Hi all! I am wondering if there is a way/or has been a way for students to 'save answer' as they go in a Moodle Quiz. Having a feature that would allow the students to 'save answer' next to each question was something I noticed Brightspace having that eased a lot of anxiety. I understand that the autosave default is 2 minutes (which we have it set to) or that by students clicking over to a new question page (when Layout is set to "new page: every question") this saves their work on the previous page, but if some faculty opt to have more than 1 question on a page or use Long essay style questions - these are both scenarios where students will be on one quiz page for a longer period time. Even having a 'save as you go' button option on the page (and not necessarily next to each question) would be a nice add. We certainly provide 'best practices' to safeguard against this but from a usability standpoint if Moodle Quiz has options for long essay questions or more than one question on a page, I am wondering why not have a 'save question' option' next to each question or on the page to mitigate potential disaster in the event of a connection issue. Would love some additional suggestions or if there is some other settings or features that might address this. Thanks! Marybeth

Forum Post: 
Post title: What I plan to do to attempt.php
Post description: I am about to do a major refactor of mod/quiz/attempt.php, and before I started, I thought I would post here to make sure I had my plans clear in my head, and to give all of you a chance to stop me if I have overlooked something vital. Why I think there is a problem It all started because I wanted to fix MDL-6368 and MDL-6369 (let question types easily include some CSS and JavaScript ). This caused me to take a long hard look at mod/quiz/attempt.php, and I realised it was a big complicated mess. This makes it difficult to maintain, which leads to bugs. Probably the underlying cause of this mess is that the one file does at least four different things: It checks all the conditions about whether the student can do the quiz (quiz open and close times, delays between attempts, number of attempts allowed, password, IP address, ...) It starts a new attempt, if necessary. It process any data that came from the previous page (if moving between pages of a multi-page quiz, or clicking one of the save/submit buttons). It displays (a page of) the quiz, for the student to enter their answers into. Also, because of 2. and 3. a lot of the time, when you are looking at the quiz attempt page, you are looking at the results of a HTTP POST request, which means that clicking the reload or back button in your browser does weird things. What I am going to do I'm going to split attempt.php into three bits: attempt.php?attemptid=X&page=Y This will just to part 4 above. It will display a single page of the quiz ready for the student to enter their answers. In can only be used to display an attempt, once that attempt has been started. The only checking it will do is to ensure that this attempt belongs to the current user, is still open, that we have not passed the close date, and the time limit has not expired. Instead of checking all the other conditions, we will store in the user's $SESSION a list of attempt ids that have been fully checked. It the student tries to go directly to attempt.php for an attempt that they started in a previous session, it will redirect them to startattempt.php. processattempt.php When you submit the form on attempt.php, it will POST the data to this page. This page just does step 3. above, that is process the responses. Once it has done the processing, it redirects the student pack to attempt.php (or review.php if they did submit all and finish).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Integrating Zoomify images into quiz module
Post description: Hi there, I've been using the zoomify tools to display high resolution images online in some online tests I manage. I've hacked this into the quiz module and thought I would throw it out there in case others could make use of it. Zoomify ( http://zoomify.com ) takes a large, high resolution image and creates a bunch of smaller, lower resolution tiles which are then loaded by the Flash movie as the user zooms in. This means that the individual files loaded are small but the resolution of what can be seen is high. This is great for detailed images that you want a student to be able to view but which would be way too large if you loaded up the full size jpg as one file. I've added some code to the /mod/quiz/locallib.php quiz_print_possible_question_image() function that looks to see if a zoomify file is available and if so, it loads the flash code into the page, if not, it displays the image as normal. I have not extensively tested it and have only tried it using the multiple choice question type so I have no idea what it might look like in other question types but it should be fine. I've attached the source code to this post. Simply replace the existing quiz_print_possible_question_image() function in /mod/quiz/locallib.php to give it a try. You will need to download zoomify, convert an image (works well converting .tif, not sure about other file types), zip up the directory that zoomify creates, upload this to your course, unzip it, create a low resolution .jpg to go along with it, upload that file to the same parent directory as the zip archive (and the new unzipped folder) and add the low resolution jpg to the question as a figure. The zoomify.swf needs to be uploaded to /mod/quiz also. In theory, now when the quiz module looks to display the figure for the question it will find the filename of the low res figure in the database , then check to see if a high res zoomify version is available and if so, it should display it.

Post title: Wrong quiz time
Post description: I had a bad experience today. I'm using 1.5.2 on LAMP (RHEL4) and set up a simple quiz with 25 question and a 45 minute time limit.  When the students took the test, it gave them 10 minutes.  I have no idea where the 10 minute setting came from, but sure enough, it kicked them out after 10 minutes.  After looking at the setting again, it still clearly says 45 minutes. Whats really frightening is that it doenst seem that anyone else is having this problem. Any suggestions are appreciated. More information - It seems to have happened because I changed the time after creating the quiz.  I created the quiz and then came back later, before the students started and changed the limit from 'unlimited' to 45 minutes. I wound up having to change the time limit back to unlimited and allow the students a second attempt.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Roadmap for future question type INDIVIDUAL
Post description: Today we have the question type RANDOM, with which we can accomplish individual quizes. Especially for numerical questions it could be neat to have another framework for attaching individual parameters of files to questions that use the same question text. This is a feature that my collegue statistics teachers have asked for and together we have come up with a possible model for the solution. As we are dealing with statistics, it comes natural to have individual stuff as individual measurement data on file. Each student gets its own file and then analyzes it according to the question text. For educational reasons it could be a good idea to have the student use the very same data file for a number of questions and quizes. In statistics this gives us the possibility to show the students how the use of different statistical tools end up with different results. We have come up with a specification that contains these key points: As data is to be reused between questions, it should be stored at category level (or simular). When an individual question is created, the individual items are chosen from the individual items that the category offers. The first time a student takes an individual question from the category, he/she will be assigned an individual dataset from that category. Whenever the student later takes another individual question from that category, he/she will reuse the same dataset that was used the first time. An individual dataset will contain a limited number of named items. The names and types of the items are defined by the teacher at category level. Example: The category "Some Category" can have four item definitions for its datasets: "number" as parameter; "bloodpressures" as file; "time for recovery" as file; "age group" as parameter. I intend to have the parameter number as an automatic default, having number=1 for the first dataset, 2 for the second etc. For each dataset the teacher then needs to upload a file 'bloodpressures' and a file 'time for recovery' and set the parameter 'age group'. If the student later gets the dataset item 'age group' for a question, the student will also be bound to always get the items 'bloodpressures', 'time for recovery' and 'number' from this dataset if he/she later have an individual question that uses any of these. My plan is to start by constructing a page for editing datasets (datasets.php). It will be reached from the "Editing quiz" page as shown in the attached example. It will store dataset definitions and datasets in these tables: CREATE TABLE `prefix_quiz_dataset_definitions` ( `id` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, `category` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL default '0', `name` varchar(255) NOT NULL default '', `type` smallint(6) NOT NULL default '0', PRIMARY KEY  (`id`), KEY `category` (`category`) ) TYPE=MyISAM COMMENT='Options for multianswer questions' CREATE TABLE `prefix_quiz_dataset_items` ( `id` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, I continue by creating the quesiton type INDIVIDUAL. When editing the question the teacher provide a question text and also pick the relevant dataset items by names. It is thereafter necessary to define the actual question type and the answers for each one of the datasets in the category. It would be useful to use some kind of file import to define these answers. I cannot offer any format for this but I hope others can come with ideas here. When the questions have got their answers they will be ready to use in quizes. I will go ahead with this now. If you wish I can have things checked in as I proceed or have a huge bunch of code submitted when all is done.

Post title: Embedded Answers scoring problem
Post description: Hello, we have a problem with the scores in the Embedded Answers quiz question type. We use Moodle 3.1. Attached, the MS doc with coded exercise (in Italian), screenshots and other data. This is the case (just one example, but it's a recurring problem for all other Embedded Answers exercises): A text with blanks to be filled (20 items). The score is 6 points for the "perfect" execution (i.e. 0.3 for each correct answer - but you know Embedded Answers lets you enter the total score (6), but not the partial (0.3) for the single item). I created it, I tried it out several times and also disabled the penalty for wrong answers. Now, if I do everything right, that is 20/20 correct answers, I get 6/6. However, if I perform only 10 right answers I always get a very strange 1.57 out of 6, whether the 10 items left are wrong or blank (i.e. I omit to fill them). I can't explain. Of course it should come 3 out of 6. Any help? Thank you for your kind attention

Forum Post: 
Post title: Scenario: using category-level question categories
Post description: A rather typical scenario - at least in our university - is that a department wants to maintain a department-level question bank that their teachers can use in their courses. Editing the inter-course question bank is limited to a few specialists. We tried to solve this by putting question categories in the course category context for department, but regular teachers who have roles only in their courses can't access it to add questions to their quizzes. Assigning every teacher a role in the department course category is a nightmare. Is it possible to allow users to use questions stored in higher-level contexts without being assigned a role in that higher-level context? Or how this is supposed to be working?

Post description: Is there a way to write pmatch questions to account for a user inputting a few answers from a short list of possibilities (like a combination problem where there are N total possible answers and they need to input K of them)? A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H are all possibilities, but I'm unsure how (if even possible) to make an answer that will check for at least any 4 of them. (Please enter your answers as a comma separated list: e.g.     green, purple, yellow) match_mw (proton? electron? neutron?) - 100% match_mw (proton? neutron? electron?) - 66.666% match_mw (* * neutron?) - 33.3333% .....etc. for all possibilities" Thanks for any advice!

Post description: A student of ours got an error message when she clicked on the Next button to navigate to the next question in her quiz. Although the error message states that the test-taker used the browser navigation buttons, I know our student didn't do this from reviewing her exam recording. The message: "You have entered
data outside of the normal sequence. This can occur if you use your browser’s
back and forward buttons, please don’t use these during the test. It can also
happen if you click on something while a page is loading. Click Continue to
resume." When she clicked "Continue" as prompted by Moodle, it took her to her Moodle profile, and she wasn't able to resume the quiz. I also tried reproducing the error but was unsuccessful (I did this by navigating away from the page as a student user, multiple times, via the browser back and forward buttons, but wasn't able to get the same error message to pop-up). Any insight on what may have caused this error to populate outside of the reasons specified by the error (since I determined that was the case), would be appreciated! Moodle Cloud version 3.8.2

Post title: New Question type development
Post description: Hi Tim I have been reading your notes on How to Write a Question Type Plugin: http://docs.moodle.org/en/How_to_write_a_question_type_plugin I am very pleased to see this as there is a question type which we badly need to develop as it is used in many of our currently paper-based courses and I haven't managed to find it anywhere else. I note in your article that the template is not complete and that you will continue to update the notes as you go along. A few questions on this: What still needs to be done before this will be ready to use? Do you have a rough estimate of when it may be completed (we all understand "rough estimate" doesn't always happen as planned)? I have not done any of this type of development before, is there some reading that I should do or things I should be looking up in preparation apart from the obvious things in Developer Docs? This one is an open question to everyone on the forum - Does anyone else have a need for a question type where the student marks themself against a model answer so that no tutor intervention is required?  This is very useful for allowing a student to see how they are doing in preparation for Exams etc where the answer is not just a single word. Thanks for the help Peter

Forum Post: 
Post title: Forcing Review of Quiz Results in Respondus Lockdown Browser
Post description: Hi All, I am planning on utilizing the Respondus Lockdown Browser for the quizzes/exams I give in my class this fall, and I've had no plans setting this up. However, I have not been able to find a way to restrict students to using the Lockdown Browser when they review their quiz/exam results. My plan was that I would allow students to review their results only for a short time while we discuss commonly missed questions in class, and then turn this review option off as soon as we were done. This way, the students would only be able to review their results in a Lockdown environment for a short period of time while I am present. I would then be able to protect the integrity of my exam questions. However, based on my experience messing around with Moodle, it appears that as long as the settings are configured so that students can review their results, they can access their results in any browser regardless of whether the original quiz was taken in a Lockdown environment. Another faculty member indicated that restricting review to the Lockdown Browser used to be an option in Moodle, but I can't seem to find it, nor can our IT department. We are currently using Moodle 3.2. Any help or workaround solutions are greatly appreciated! Thanks!

Forum Post: 
Post title: "Correct" and a red cross can appear simultaneously in a calculated question. Why have it so?
Post description: In a calculated question (Moodle 1.9), it seems to me that an answer is marked as "Correct" if it falls within the tolerance band of the exact answer. However, it is marked with a green tick if it falls within the tolerance band of the rounded answer (i.e. the answer rounded to the required number of, for example, significant figures). On occasion, this leads to an answer marked as "Correct" but given a red cross and, at other times, to an answer marked as "Incorrect" but given a green tick. The frequency of occurrence can be minimised by increasing the number of sig figs but I wonder why this is how things are set up. What advantage does this offer that outweighs the confusion engendered when it's first encountered? I'm new to this, by the way, and find Moodle impressive but I couldn't find the answer to my query after digging round for a bit. Graham

Post title: Comments on CBM Quiz
Post description: I've had automatic emails with comments on specific questions in somone's quizzes, sent to me at cusplap@ucl.ac.uk . The contexts are below and I can forward these comments if you recognise the contexts and email me. I think this results from someone having adapted CBM code at www.ucl.ac.uk/lapt/moodle19/moodle without suitable modification for their own Moodle. Note that the arrangements on this UCL site (for students to enter comments) depend on local facilities. They demonstrate what I do think would be desirable functionality in Moodle, but full portability will require fairly extensive recoding to use Moodle database structures instead of UCL arrangements within LAPT. CONTEXT 1: 20080103, 1645.79, (Ex) Sageknowledge 1.0 Quiz. If this is your first time in this course, select enroll me in this course on the left side of the page., Q=11: What is the oldest surviving system of laws?, R=Hebrew Tora, M=-2 CONTEXT 2: 20080103, 1825.37, (Ex) Sageknowledge 1.0 Quiz. If this is your first time in this course, select enroll me in this course on the left side of the page., Q=27: Critical thinking is emotionless thinking., R=True, M=-2

Forum Post: Post title: Sub question level feedback for Cloze questions Post description: TLDR : How to set a sub-question level feedback for Cloze type questions ? As per the documentation, Cloze type question either have answer option level feedback or a General feedback across all sub-questions. Is there a way to set a sub-question level feedback instead of the option level feedback ? Explanation : For normal MCQs , a line starting with '####' provides a common feedback for the question. In the Cloze subquestion, there is either an option to put a feedback after each answer option, beginning with '#" or there is an option to provide a 'general feedback' across multiple questions. Is there some option to use the #### type feedback for Cloze sub-questions instead of the # after each choice ? Sample sub-question of a Cloze type question : This is Sub question 1. {:MCV: %-25%Wrong answer#Feedback ~ %-25%Another wrong answer#Feedback ~ =Correct answer#Feedback ~ %-25%Another wrong answer#Feedback } Sample Regular Multiple choice question :

Question text of a normal MCQ

{ ~%-25%

wrong answer 1

~%-25%

wrong answer 2

=

correct answer

~%-25%

wrong answer 3

####

Forum Post: 
Post title: Maximum number of users taking a quiz simultaneously
Post description: I read, from https://docs.moodle.org/20/en/User_site_capacities (no page seems to exist for 3.0+) : ... The exact number of users depends on your hardware/software/network combination. Usually the amount of memory installed (RAM) is the deciding factor but a faster overall processor speed will also help in reducing waiting times for pages to load. The general rule of thumb for a single server is that the approx max concurrent users = RAM (GB) * 50 and the approx max browsing users = Approx max concurrent users * 5. As an example, a university with 500 total computers on campus and 100 concurrent users at any time will need approx 2GB of RAM on the one server to support the number of concurrent users... Our government has state wide exams. According to the above rule of thumb and with a 100 000 / 50 = 2 000 GB = 2 TB web server or bigger, could 100 000 users take exactly the same quiz simultaneously? Also, would the waiting time for feedback during the quiz be reasonable? Best regards to all.

Post description: Hi, i use 4 kinds of datasets in my questions: a) (a,b) with a,b>0 b) (a,b) with a,b<0 c) (a,b) with a<0,b>0 d) (a,b) with a>0,b<0 for each set there are 5-10 questions in different categories. Is there any possibility to reuse all 4 datasets? Can I have only 1 of these datasets to be shared with other calculated questions? It's annoying for me to create the datasets b)-d) again and again (20-30 times).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Question ID XXXX was missing an options record
Post description: Hi everyone, I encountered a warning in Moodle 4.1 and wanted to check if anyone else has experienced this issue. Warning message: 
```text
Question ID 47642 was missing an options record. Using default.
line 48 of /question/type/multichoice/questiontype.php: call to debugging()
line 146 of /question/type/multianswer/questiontype.php: call to qtype_multichoice->get_question_options()
...
```
 How it happened: I first created a Cloze question with an embedded multichoice (version 1). Later, I edited the question and changed the embedded type to numerical (version 2). When I preview version 1 of the question, the warning appears. The issue doesn’t seem to be blocking anything since it's just a warning, not an error. We also encountered a similar warning when restoring a course with cloze questions that changed the embedded question types. I just wanted to document the issue and check if anyone else has come across this. Is this a known issue? Thanks! Cheers, susana

Post title: Moodle 1.6.5 Moodle XML Import FIX for Short Answer Question Errors
Post description: Hi All, I'm posting this in case any one else is having this same problem. I don't know if this has been resolved (or is even an issue) in newer versions, but this is what is happening in version 1.6.5 for us. ERRORS ON SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS - HOW TO FIX XML FILE The Moodle XML file is reporting errors on short answer question imports. It will state in the import dialog that there was no matching grade for this question type. Here's how you fix this: First, delete ALL of the questions you just imported from the question bank (that category that you just imported questions into).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Adaptive mode
Post description: I am so sure this question has been raised, but I have not seen it yet when I search for it. The adaptive mode is not working in the way I assumed it would. It appears to calculate the penalties based on the question's total marks. So a 3 mark question (with 33% penalties) has -1, -2 applied at try 2 and 3 respectively. The problem is when you have partial marks coded. So I have one example where a student, on her 3rd try, got an answer that would have scored 2/3 if she gave it on her 1st try. The penalty though meant she scored 0, even though she actually worked out a 'valid' answer. My original thought was that the adaptive mode would give 2/3 - 66%, which is 0.68/3. This was important for her, as it was the difference between a pass and fail on her paper. I've had this on other questions. I had a whopper 13 mark 'Moodle formulas' question in adaptive mode that did not work as I thought at all. If the student got, say 5/13 on the first try, then fixed questions so that they would get 10/13, the score became 5.71/13 and not what I would expect 6.7/13. So this is clearly something that is coded into the core and can't just change, so I wonder what my options are moving forward? Is there some other plugin that does what I am thinking? Maybe my thinking is wrong? Maybe students should be penalised in the way it is happening? What I wonder is whether the adaptive mode was considered initially for simple pass/fail answers, and not partial grading which the calculation questions and pattern-match question types afford students. kind regards Gareth

Post description: Hi. I'm administrating a moodle platform that was poorly designed. The way it worked before showed repeated questions to students, and now at least I was able to low the chances of a question to be shown twice to the same student. I'll explain the problem briefly: I have a bank of 20 questions, the system is supposed to show 5 random questions to students (there should be 25 questions to be able to use 5 random questions that have 0 chances of being repeated, but I don't have that amount). The old administrator just did 5 questions from the same 20, which is the worse that what I thought (once it was explained to me by my boss how it works now and has worked for years now, I said "we might have a problem here"): I divided the 20 questions in 5 groups of 4 (where the intersection between each bank is empty) and was expecting it to work great, but it didn't, since each random question requires at least a bank of 5 questions. so 4 banks of 5 questions where the intersection of those is empty and one bank of the 20 questions seems a little better since the probability of getting the same question twice is now lower, I still don't like it one bit. Can I lower the minimum of questions to 4 in the configuration? I wasn't able to find it yet. Another option would be to use the same bank but to remove the question that was asked every time a question is made, but of course this seems unnecessary since the problem would be solved being able to tweek that. Thanks a lot!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Something for TIM HUNT
Post description: Hi Tim Please allow me to draw your attention to this conversation http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=55792 Once you have seen this post you'd appreciate that the following lines are an exce rpt from moodle help file for gift format Feedback: Feedback can be included for each answer by
following the answer with a number sign (# also known as a hash mark)
and the feedback. 
```text
     What's the answer to this multiple-choice question?{


     ~wrong answer#feedback comment on the wrong answer


     ~another wrong answer#feedback comment on this wrong answer


     =right answer#Very good!}


     


     Who's buried in Grant's tomb?{
```
 For Multiple Choice questions, feedback is displayed only for the answer the student selected. For short answer, feedback is shown only when students input the corresponding correct answer. For true-false questions, the imported feedback is saved so that it will display if the student chose the wrong answer.
So, in the last example above, the student would see the feedback only if they selected TRUE as their answer.

We have up to 15 sections of the same class, which means they have the same tests.  I'm using question banks and randomization to ensure seperate tests for every student, but sometimes the dates of the tests change. Is there anyway to set the dates of several activities at once?  Quizzes, or assignments? Also, is there a way to make one test, and then put it in all of the courses?  I know I can copy material from one course to another, but that is a slower process, and I haven't tested it much.  I know for a fact that it doesn't copy the labels for the topics....and for 15 sections, that is a pain. Thanks for any help. Thomas

Forum Post: 
Post title: Viewing/Reviewing a Quiz Without Having Taken it?
Post description: A student joined my full-year course in mid-year.  I told all students they can review (for the final exam) by looking at all the quizzes (which I have set to expose all Responses Scores Feedback Answers after the quiz is closed). However, this new student cannot see anything, because she never took the quiz in the first place! As a temporary measure, I disabled the quiz-close-date, let her "take" the quiz by simply starting it, then clicking Submit.    Then I re-enable the original close-date, and she can see the answers. But is there a more elegant way to allow students to see quiz questions and answers even after it's closed?

Forum Post: Post title: Quiz Score Breakdown by Category Post description: Hello everyone. I asked a while ago about by-category score details for quizzes and saw that many other people wanted this as well. Anyway, I made a quick way to do it that: gives you the option to show the score details to the user for each category in the quiz in the order the category appears in the quiz works with multiple-page quizzes can easily be tweaked in format and content If anyone's interested, give it a try and let me know what you think. It should also work in moodle 1.7, but I have not tested thoroughly in later versions. Hope you don't mind the big post. A zipped pdf of the instructions is attached as well. Adding Question Category Grade Breakdown for Quizzes in Moodle 1.6.2 Add a new column showcategorygrades to the quiz table. This will be used to make the category grade breakdown optional. ALTER TABLE mdl_quiz ADD COLUMN showcategorygrades int2; ALTER TABLE mdl_quiz ALTER COLUMN showcategorygrades SET STORAGE PLAIN; ALTER TABLE mdl_quiz ALTER COLUMN showcategorygrades SET DEFAULT 0; Add the following lines to quiz/config.html html to show the control for toggling the showcategorygrades property when configuring quizzes in your moodle . // SRC: Set the category grade control if it is not set Add the following lines to quiz/mod.html to show the control for toggling the showcategorygrades property when editing a quiz. // SRC: Set the category grade control if it is not set if (!isset($form->showcategorygrades)) { $form->showcategorygrades = $CFG->quiz_showcategorygrades; } … quiz_fix_decimalpoints) { ?> : showcategorygrades, ""); helpbutton("showcategorygrades", get_string("showcategorygrades", "quiz"), "quiz"); ?> Add the following line to lang/en-UTF8/quiz.php. This is the English translation for the control label in the forms you edited in steps 2 and 3. $string [ 'showcategorygrades' ] = 'Show category grades' ; Add the following lines to quiz/review.php. This is what will actually show the category grade breakdown in the quiz report. // SRC: Add categories string for breakdown section label $strcategories = get_string( "categories" , "quiz" ); // SRC: Load all the questions for the category breakdown if report is paginated if (! $showall && $quiz ->showcategorygrades == 1) { $allquizquestionids = quiz_questions_in_quiz( $attempt ->layout); $ sql = "SELECT q.*, i.grade AS maxgrade, i.id AS instance" . " FROM { $CFG->prefix }question q," . " { $CFG->prefix }quiz_question_instances i" . " WHERE i.quiz = ' $quiz->id ' AND q.id = i.question" . " AND q.id IN ( $allquizquestionids )" ; if (! $allquestions = get_records_sql( $sql )) { error( 'No questions found' ); } // Load the question type specific information if (!get_question_options( $allquestions )) { error( 'Could not load question options' ); } // Restore the question sessions to their most recent states // creating new sessions where required if (! $allstates = get_question_states( $allquestions , $quiz , $attempt )) { error( 'Could not restore question sessions' ); } } if ( $showall && $quiz ->showcategorygrades == 1) { $allquestions = $questions ; $allstates = $states ; } … // SRC: Category breakdown if it is enabled. if ( $quiz ->showcategorygrades == 1) { $categorybreakdown = array (); $gradescale = $quiz ->grade/ $quiz ->sumgrades; foreach ( $allquestions as $question ) { if (! isset ( $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category])) { $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category] = array (); $questioncategory = get_record( 'question_categories' , 'id' , $question ->category); $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "categoryname" ] = $questioncategory ->name; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "maxgrade" ] = 0; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledmaxgrade" ] = 0; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "rawgrade" ] = 0; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledrawgrade" ] = 0; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "grade" ] = 0; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledgrade" ] = 0; } $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "maxgrade" ] += $question ->maxgrade; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledmaxgrade" ] += $question ->maxgrade* $gradescale ; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "rawgrade" ] += $allstates [ $question ->id]->raw_grade; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledrawgrade" ] += $allstates [ $question ->id]->raw_grade* $gradescale ; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "grade" ] += $allstates [ $question ->id]->grade; $categorybreakdown [ $question ->category][ "scaledgrade" ] += $allstates [ $question ->id]->grade* $gradescale ; } $cattable ->align = array ( "right" , "left" ); foreach ( $categorybreakdown as $catinfo ) { $categorypercentage = round (( $catinfo [ "rawgrade" ]/ $catinfo [ "maxgrade" ])*100,0); $cattable ->data[] = array ( $catinfo [ "categoryname" ], round ( $catinfo [ "scaledgrade" ], $CFG ->quiz_decimalpoints). "/" . round ( $catinfo [ "scaledmaxgrade" ], $CFG ->quiz_decimalpoints). " (" . $categorypercentage . "%)" ); } } … // SRC: Print category breakdown if ( $cattable ) { echo '
' . $strcategories . '
' ; print_table( $cattable ); } Create a new file in \lang\en_utf8\help\quiz named showcategorygrades.html. This is the help file for this setting.

Show Category Grades

If you enable this option, a question category grade breakdown will be displayed on the quiz results page.

Categories will be listed in the order they appear in the quiz.

The intention is to provide students with more detailed feedback regarding their quiz performance.

Post title: Subnet Limitation
Post description: Currently, subnet is defined as a varchar 255 for quizzes.  In my use case, I need to extend that to a varchar 2,000, which I hope will be enough to acommodate our campuses, but with continued growth, it may not.  My question is two fold: 1. If I change the structure of variable in the database to a varchar(2000), will it break anything else?  (Which includes the weekly builds we implement from Moodle 3.3 STABLE branch) 2. Does the form in the quiz where we set the subnet from have an input limitation which is coded other than from the definition of the field size set in the database. Any answers from the development side would be greatly appreciated, as I am currently at 247 characters, and still need to add additional campuses, so have had to begin reducing security to entirely too many IP addresses.  ie. instead of 1.2.3.4, I have had to implement 1.2.3. just to cover what we have, and additional IP addresses are coming online as our needs grow.

Post title: A warning about import of true/false questions in GIFT format
Post description: I want to import questions into a quiz. All questionas are of type true/false. I read from the help that the format... 
```text
True-False:
 In this question-type the answer indicates whether the statement is true or false.
 The answer should be written as {TRUE} or {FALSE}, or abbreviated to {T} or {F}.
 Grant is buried in Grant's tomb.{F}
 The sun rises in the east.{T}
```
 Then I tried to export a hand-added true/false question and I found that Moodle exports questions in the format: 
```text
// question 1 name: 1.1
 ::1.1::[html]Are you happy?{TRUE}
```
 but what is missing in the help file is the possibility to add a question name the tag [html] that have never seen the need to separate each question from the previous one by a blank line, otherwise moodle will import all question as a unique, very long, question. Hoping this can help someone.

Post description: I'm using Moodle 2.7.1 A teacher has created a new course with about 50 quizzes and over 300 questions. But, she has saved all the questions to the course level question bank. We now want to duplicate the course and the backup and restore files are of course huge. I can move all the questions to a system level question bank.  But if I go to the course, they all still appear to be in the original question bank at course level. In future, we will be careful to add questions from the system level course bank, but is there an easier way to solve this problem now, other than going through and editing every question?

Forum Post: Post title: Having trouble getting mp3 to play in quiz...please help Post description: Calling all php gurus, I could really use some help here.  I posted this problem already in the General Problems forum, but I've had no replies.  I'm hoping somebody here knows what's up. I having difficulty getting mp3's to play in my quizzes.  Part of the problem is due to some restrictions on the classroom computers (where I need to run the lessons for classes) from my school's internal network and the Sky Menu system.  It won't let Moodle call up the flash mp3 stream player.  Instead it calls up an embedded mini Windows Media Player.  OK, no problem, right?  Wrong.  If I insert an mp3 file into a Moodle-made webpage (either via embedding with html code through the html editor or by simply linking some text to the mp3 file), then the embedded mini WMP is called and it plays just fine.  However, if I insert the EXACT SAME CODE into a quiz question, then the embedded html code produces nothing (I mean nothing, as if no code was entered) and linking text to the mp3 file produces the embedded mini WMP, instead of the stream player, but the WMP player won't play.    To make things even weirder, what I just described is what happens when I open the quiz, i.e. viewing the finished product or in seeing in a preview screen.  However, if I open the quiz up up for editting, either the quiz or the questions, then the mini WMP from the embedding html code shows up AND plays in the editting screen, the same player that disappears in the editting screen.  YES-it shows up AND plays in the WYSIWYG editting screen. Here are two links.  The first is to a Moodle-made webpage on my site.  The second is to a single-question quiz in the same couse.  (You can log in as GUEST for both of these.) webpage quiz The EXACT SAME html code has been placed in the webpage, the quiz introduction and the quiz question.  What you see as the flash mp3 stream player shows up in my classroom computers as the mini WMP and in the webpage it plays fine but not at all in the quiz.  What you see as the mini WMP in the webpage is the same in my classroom computers; notice you don't see it in the quiz though the code is the same.  The code is ...

< object id="mediaplayer1" height="40" width="170" classid="CLSID:22d6f312-b0f6-11d0-94ab-0080c74c7e95">

PLAY

I really need to get this to work if at all possible, so I'd really appreciate any help any of you gurus could offer.  Is there some code I need to alter in one of the Quiz or Filter php files to make quizes operate (with respect to this problem) the same as the Moodle-built webpages (resource)?  Thanks in advance. --Jim Label:

Post title: Page Break
Post description: Hi all, I'm facing a problem with page break in Moodle quiz. I created quiz with 30 questions with the Shuffle checked. Then I decided to have the page break after question #20. I want to do this due to a number of reasons. I don't want to use random questions because I want to be easier to track the questions on Statistic. I know that there is a Repaginate. However, Repaginate only allow to break the page in even number of questions per page. In this case, I have different questions per page. And even I used Repaginate, the page break is also not working when the Shuffle is ON. I think I used this before and it works before because I created this quiz since we were on MOODLE 3.2. Now we are on MOODLE 3.3 and I go back and found this issue. My question is How do I have a page break working with the Shuffle ON? Please help, Thank.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Quiz module - let the instructor allow the student to continue and finish even after timeout.
Post description: Greetings, Here is a request from one of the faculty I support: This is a quiz feature request to let an instructor let a student continue a quiz that has timed out before completion. Several of my students reported losing their quiz data. I'm not certain, but I think my students' problems occur because they are failing to perform a "submit and finish" for a variety of reasons. (Some students mistakenly believe that the countdown timer stops after submitting and exiting before doing a "submit and finish" and they time out. Other students just lose track of time. My apologies if these scenarios cannot occur.) When I investigate, I see that their exam is still open, but that time has expired, and their score is zero. I am unable to recover the quiz but I am gradually discovering the degree to which I can see through WebAccess item analysis what the student had been attempting at the time of timeout. I usually have to come up with some compromise with the student. So the request is for WebAccess to let the instructor allow the student to continue and finish even after timeout. The version they are now is 1.6 but are going to 1.8 soon.  I don't see this capability in 1.8.  Thanks for any input on this request. Steve Murray

Post title: Best way to create multi language quiz questions.
Post description: I have searched a lot in the forums but did not find anything. I am on Moodle 3.5.3. I have the following scenario: - I have 100 courses, the courses are called say course 1, course 2, course 3... - Each course has the same 30 quizzes. The quizzes are called say Quiz A, Quiz B, Quiz C.... - Each Quiz has 10 questions. The questions in Quiz A are called Question A1, A2, A3, and in Quiz B are called Question B1, B2, B3... - All questions are on Core System context . In total app. 500 questions. - When I have a typo in say question B2, I can correct this typo in Question B2 and the correction will show up in all courses. All this is in German language. I now need to provide the quizzes in English language. What is the best way to do this? I cannot use multi-language filter because it is not working with cloze question type. My current approach would be to: 1. create a new category called Quiz A (English) 2. Export all questions from category Quiz A. 3. Translate the export file from German to English language. 4. Post title: Essay questions adding general feedback post quiz.
Post description: My workflow has always been Write question (save question), run exam, mark exam, update model answers & general feedback to questions (save question). Publish quiz with feedback (General feedback check-box). Spot the problem. Post title: Question shuffling...
Post description: Is there any chance of making the Shuffle option a question category option rather than a Quiz option? The issue I'm encountering is that using Shuffle precludes using any multiple-choice questions that include All of the above, None of the above, Both a and b, etc. It's currently an all-or-nothing proposition. You either have shuffle on for all questions or off for all questions. However, if this were turned into a question category option, you could then have banks of questions where question answers can be shuffled, and those that remain static, and pull from different banks as needed. It would allow the best of both worlds, so to speak... within a single quiz. Thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Dynamic random quiz
Post description: As far as I have got into my first use of the quiz module, I do see how I can create a static quiz containing a number of questions preselected at random from a superset of existing questions. However, except for shuffling, a participant reruns the same quiz each attempt. For practice/review I had in mind a dynamically generated quiz. Does this exist at present? Namely, for every attempt, a student receives a different selection of questions from the superset, not just a shuffled version of the preselected. Recording grades is not a priority. Suppose the superset consists subsets for each chapter. Suppose each subset contains 100 questions. Thus Quiz 1 would have a parameter set to dynamically construct a new quiz of, say, 10 questions from Chapter 1. Quiz 2 ditto for 10 questions from Chapter 2 Then for cumulative review: Quiz 2-R  ditto with 10 questions randomly drawn from Chapters 1 and 2. Perhaps additional parameters could specify a weighting factor for each chapter's contribution.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Should we treat blank answers separately?
Post description: Suppose you've got a short answer question, and the student types nothing, then clicks 'submit', or 'submit all and finish'. Is that a wrong answer? Obviously, if they leave that as their final answer, they will get 0 marks, but should they be told 'incorrect', or should say something else, like 'No answer given'? And should they be given the wrong-answer feedback (feedback associated with answer '*' in the short-answer case)? And should they have a penalty applied? (Presumbably the answer to that depends on whether they have seen helpful feedback.) At the moment, when you submit a blank answer, if you do it the first time you see the question, the system just redisplays the question with no change, ignoring your submit. If you submit any non-blank answer, then submit a blank answer, you get told 'Incorrect'. That is so inconsistent, it's a bug and I need to make it consistent. Similar considerations apply to other question types, and obviously we should adopt the same approach everywhere.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Excessive Growth in mdl_question Table After Upgrading to from 4.4 to 4.5
Post description: Issue Summary After upgrading from Moodle 4.4.2 to 4.5 , we have encountered an extreme and unexpected increase in the `mdl_question` table size, leading to major performance concerns. Before upgrade : The table contained approximately 400,000 rows . After upgrade : The table has grown beyond 11 million rows in just a week or so . Key concern : The issue seems to occur when creating and duplicating quizzes , even before students attempt them. Observations & Testing We ran controlled tests in both Moodle 4.4 and 4.5 with identical quiz creation steps: Added a quiz with two questions from the question bank (no randomization). Moodle 4.4 : Number of rows does not change. Moodle 4.5 : 60 rows were added to `mdl_question` and related tables. Duplicated the quiz within the same course : Moodle 4.4 : Normal behavior. Moodle 4.5 : The duplication process added 120 more rows . Duplicated the quiz again : This time, the table grew by 240 more rows . It appears that each duplication exponentially increases the number of rows in `mdl_question` . Key Considerations Answering the quiz does not seem to be the trigger— the growth happens upon creation and duplication . The exponential increase in records suggests redundant or unnecessary question entries may be created in the database . We previously had hundreds of thousands of redundant rows before the upgrade, indicating that this issue may have been affecting us even earlier, but it has become much more severe in Moodle 4.5 . `mdl_question_bank_entries` has also grown significantly, mirroring the pattern in `mdl_question` . Questions for the Community Has anyone else observed excessive row creation in `mdl_question` after upgrading to Moodle 4.5? Is this a known bug or a schema change in Moodle 4.5 that affects quiz duplication? Does Moodle 4.5 handle question versioning differently, possibly duplicating questions unnecessarily? Are there safe ways to clean up `mdl_question` without breaking existing quizzes? Have there been changes made to how Moodle duplicates Quiz's? Any insights or recommendations would be greatly appreciated!

Forum Post: 
Post title: New table question_attempts
Post description: This post is probably only of interest to quiz module developers, not to most users. The quiz module often has a need for knowing whether a particular question is in use. For example when you want to delete a question the code first checks whether that question is already being used. If it is it will allow you to hide the question but not to delete it completely because otherwise all the data about student attempts at the question would become inconsistent. Now there is a problem with random questions which in an actual student attempt are replaced randomly by some question from the chosen category. The quiz module code currently has no efficient way of finding out whether a particular question has been chosen randomly in a given quiz. There is a table quiz_question_instances which one might think would do the job but it does only record the random question id, not the id of the questions that was actually used in the various student attempts. So I propose to introduce a new table quiz_question_attempts (later to be recalled just question_attempts once I get the go-ahead for separating questions from quizzes) with fields 'question' and 'attempt' which gets an entry whenever a question is used in a student attempt at a quiz. This table would then make it easy with one database query to discover whether a question is in use.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Advice for managing a large question bank? (3000+)
Post description: Hi Guys, We've got a large question bank with nearly 3000 questions and growing, organized into a tree of categories at the system context level, and administrating it is now putting quite a strain on our server . I'm looking for advice on if there's a better way to structure our question bank to work more efficiently with Moodle. We provide personalized courses to language students, so rather than one large standardised course that all students follow, each student has their own course to which activities are duplicated. To facilitate this, we're heavy users of the Sharing Cart block. To avoid duplicating the data of every quiz at the course level, our questions are stored under the system context for universal access. However we've now come to a bit of a hurdle, as it seems when you backup a quiz in Moodle, it also backups up every single object in the included questions' context. That means for every quiz we copy into a student's course, Moodle goes through the process of backing up our entire database , bringing the site to its knees. Currently, our question bank is structured a bit like this... Beginners Vocabulary Adults Animals Numbered subcategories containing 6-8 questions each Drinks Numbered subcategories Fruit Numbered subcategories Vegetables etc, etc. ...and so on and so forth. Prepared activities are stored in a similarly structured category of hidden courses, which our teachers then use to copy the desired activities into their students' classrooms. The only "solution" I can think of is to store the questions of our quizzes at the course level context. We'll end with lots of duplicate data & a rapidly growing database, however at least Moodle won't be brought to its knees every time we try to copy a single quiz of just a couple of questions. Can anyone think of a better way to do this? (Related links: How to minimize the question bank when doing backup/restore , [MDL-41924] , [MDL-12403] )

Forum Post: 
Post title: Ignoring whitespace in short answer
Post description: I am running a JAVA course. I have the following short answer question in one of my quizzes. Write code that will convert the contents of the String variable myVar to upper case and assign this to a new variable (as yet undeclared) called "resultVar". I used a "short answer" question and gave options for all possibilities -- the only differences from one answer to another was the white space. If I could have had something to ignore white space (similar to ignore case), it would have been very helpful. eg: the general answer could have been specified as: String resultVar#=#myVar.toUpperCase#(#)#; (where a space is 1 or more spaces and a # is 0 or more spaces). Leading and trailing spaces are ignored. With 5 #'s in the previous answer, I would have to have @@2^5@@ options just to cover the bare minimum, and that assumes that no-one uses double spaces! Is this something that others would find useful, or am I alone? If so, I'll file a feature request! Philip

Post title: cause of missing responses in history moodle 1.7
Post description: Hi All, I was wondering if anyone had theories as to why the below occurs when only a couple of tests are being written concurrently.  It shouldn't be a performance issue as there were 140 writing with same server /moodle configuration and we didn't see missing responses below. Forum Post: 
Post title: Sharing is not copying
Post description: Sharing is defined as the joint use of a resource . If I share my lunch with you, we both eat from the same plate.  If I make you a sandwich just like mine, it is another form of charity, but it's no not sharing. In the same way, "sharing questions" means using the same questions, not copies. On our moodle site, we share questions.  Course #1 has a large question database .  Categories are published so they are visible to all teachers.    Only the editing teachers of course #1 (so far, only the site admin) can add, delete, modify, or re-categorize questions.  Teachers in other courses use these questions to create quizzes for their students.   The teachers see read-only questions in read-only categories.  If a teacher finds a mistake in a question, they report it to the site admin, who fixes it.   The mistake only needs to be fixed once, and the question magically is fixed in every quiz in which it appears. So far, everything works beautifully.  However there are some special quizzes (example: the Final exam), which must be identical in every course.   How can this be guaranteed? I experimented with two possibilities: Create the Final in course #1 and allow teachers to Import it. I can't imagine a worse solution.  First, we would have to make the teachers editing teachers of course #1, which would compromise the security of the question database.  Second, Import copies the questions, not just the quiz.  Furthermore, it copies all the other questions from the same categories, and it creates local categories for these questions. Create the Final in course #1, Backup course #1 with just this quiz, put the backup in a public place, and allow teachers to Restore (adding content to their courses) from the backup. Except that teachers don't need to be made editors in course #1, this solution has all the disadvantages of Import . I fully expected Import and Backup/Restore to copy activities , but until I experimented with them, I had no idea that they would make such deep copies.

Post description: Hi there! On Moodle 4.4.1+ quiz settings pages are not scrollable on iPad Pro 12.9", iOS 17.5, iPad 10.5", iOS 15.0 using either Safari or Chrome . This occurs in both Boost and Classic themes. The only scrollable area is inside the Atto editor; the rest of the form remains locked, even when tapping outside or trying to swipe. Tested on: Moodle 4.4.1+ (clean install, no custom theme) iPad Pro 12.9", iOS 17.5, iPad 10.5", iOS 15.0 Safari and Chrome Boost theme (default) Classic theme Attempts to fix (none successful): Custom CSS to force `overflow-y: auto` and `-webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch` JavaScript to manually enable scroll on `.mform` , `.card-body` , `#region-main` Switching to Classic theme per user Creating new admin user This appears to be an iOS-specific bug caused by the way Moodle's form layout and containers are structured. It prevents any meaningful quiz editing on iPad, requiring desktop access to perform basic admin tasks. Steps to reproduce: Log into Moodle as an admin on iPad Pro 12.9" Open a quiz and click on "Edit settings" Attempt to scroll the settings form Only the Atto editor scrolls; all other parts of the page remain unresponsive. Is this a known issue?? Thank you so much in advance, Tiziana

Post title: Safe Exam Browser Pros and Cons
Post description: It's that time of year again to renew Respondus Lock-down browser, and I would like to know the pros and cons of using Safe Exam Browser instead.  Here are the drawbacks I see: 1.  Since the code is open-source, it is easier to hack 2.  I heard it can't be used on student-owned computers, but I don't think that's true 3. It looks more complicated to use and setup than Respondus, for everyone involved. I really haven't found an easy to read "this is how you set it up and use it" as the teacher or student. 4. Support for problems would not be as good as Respondus. We had a lot of problems with wifi last year and I don't want to switch to something and have the students have different problems this coming year (hopefully wifi problems are taken care of!).

Post title: Detection of cheating/plagiarism in essay type questions
Post description: On a quiz, one of the problems is an essay type answer, where students are supposed to enter a mix of technical text, and equations + numbers. I want to find out if there is any plugin available which can be used to compare student responses and tell the instructor about the likelihood that part or all of the answer was copied from another student, or has common features that warrant further investigation. It is impossible to specify this completely as I am looking for any helpful tool that could help. Needless to add, the essay type question will be manually graded, so something that generates a summary map pointing to attempts of concern would be most helpful. The instructor has to obviously exert the final judgment, but a supportive tool is helpful when you have a very large number of students, and by the time you are grading the 133rd attempt, you have mostly forgotten about the 15th. I have looked at the auto-graded essay type question and that is not what I want. The bigger concern here is students copying from each other, rather than from some known source(s).

Post description: My name is Jesse. I am an IT student at Borrego Springs High school, & w e are beginning to use moodle as an online tool to administrate a school wide quiz to regulate computer control. So far it has been working, but to make this easier we are going to issue cards to have on their [the students] persons at all times at school. I have been issued as the person that will put the quiz into moodle.learningtech.net & then tell the students where to go, etc.The quiz we are using we got from a seperate school & is a HTML format document on a CD. So far I have run into several problems.
